bibliography: H. Erbse, pap. VI (vol. II, p. 222-227); A. Körte, APF 6 (1920), p. 253; M. Haslam, BASP 22 (1985), p. 100 n. 3 (date); L. Leurini, in: Tradizione e innovazione, I, 1993, p. 160; cf. A. Lamedica Nardi, SCO 26 (1977), p. 133-155; further bibliography in CPF I.1***, no. 107, 1T [Xenophanes].
plates: ed. princ. pl. IV; Schubart, Griech. Pal., pl. 78 (col. 2 part); Erbse, vol. II; CPF IV.2, pl. 161.
author: anon.
contents: scholia of comprehensive scope on Iliad 7.75-83, mainly of linguistic and stylistic interest, with minor mythological information, but containing an important list of paronymi.
propernames:
col. 1:Helenos;Apollôn (1 + Q);Hektôr (1 + Q);Zeus (Q);Ida (Q);Kroniôn (Q);Troizênos [Troizên];Pindaros;Charopos [Charops];Chalybos;Euripidês;Têmenos;Melêtos;Sokratês;Simônidês;Hermeias (Q) [Hermês];
col. 2:Aischylos;Phineus (2);Sophoklês;Kratinos;Archilochos;Simônidês;Erykos [Eryx];Xenophanês;Antimachos;Aidos [Haidês];Leandrios;Kaônos [Kaôn]; Eupolis;Kleônymos;Stêsichoros;Korythos;Alexandros;Paris;Kêyx;Alkaios;Hêsiodos;Leukôn;Trôos (1 + Q) [Trôs];Teukros (Q):Ananios;Euripidês; Aigeus;Mênis;Aitôloi [Aetolians];Lokroi [Locrians];
col. 3:Phryges [Phrygians];Kallimachos (?, R);Lykophrôn (?, R);Apollôn (Q).
statepreservation:
col. 1: 33 lines broken off by a few letters to the left and damaged at top of column;
col. 2: 33 lines at full width;
col. 3: beginnings of 33 lines;
large upper (4 cm) and lower (6 cm) margins.
lectionalsigns: paragraphos (several); double dots at end of note; occasional accents; some abbreviations; lemmata (and sometimes lines) in ekthesis; small horizontals above numerals; iota adscript consistently written.
hand: small (certainly not "satis magna", cf. Erbse), informal, round, leaning forward, generally bilinear and regular, neat and clear, rapidly and competently written with many cursive elements, mostly linking the letters.
